business.headline: Amazon, Flipkart and major smartphone brands face antitrust heat: ReportThe Competition Commission of India (CCI) has found that these companies have been involved in exclusive product launches on their platforms, which may have restricted competition and harmed smaller businesses.

Rent vs buy: What's the smarter financial move for you?Renting offers the freedom to move, explore career opportunities, and invest in other ventures. Buying a home, on the other hand, offers long-term security, a sense of ownership, and equity building.

Centre approves Madhya Pradesh's request for soybean procurement at MSPUnion Agriculture and Farmer Welfare Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan confirmed that the proposal from the Madhya Pradesh government was received and approved late Tuesday.

Centre lifts minimum export price cap on onion, basmati riceThe $950 per tonne minimum export price for basmati rice has been removed while the export duty on onion has been cut to 20 per cent from 40 per cent, in effect from September 14.

Bajaj Housing Finance IPO: Will it double investors' wealth on market debut?Bajaj Housing Finance IPO listing: With the GMP indicating a significant upside, all eyes are now on whether the shares will live up to the hype and deliver the bumper listing gains many expect.

Trump allies plan to privatise Fannie and Freddie, says reportThe discussions involve prominent figures close to Trump, including Larry Kudlow, the former director of the National Economic Council, and John McEntee, who previously worked in the White House.

Sebi chief addresses conflict of interest allegations with 3 big clarificationsThe Buchs firmly denied any wrongdoing, offering detailed explanations to counter allegations tied to consulting roles, rental income, and Madhabi Puri Buch's ICICI Bank stock options.
Sensex, Nifty end lower as markets take breather after strong rallyThe S&P BSE Sensex fell 135.83 points to 82,926.88, while the NSE Nifty50 settled 43 points lower at 25,345.90.

Bajaj Housing Finance IPO: Cash in on listing day or wait for long-term gain? Brokerages tracking the IPO have already indicated that the IPO is set for a positive listing, with the grey market premium (GMP) indicating that investors will see their money double on listing day.

Sebi chief, husband reject conflict of interest charges, call it false, motivatedIn a joint statement, Sebi chief Madhabi Puri Buch and husband Dhaval Buch rejected recent allegations of conflict of interest as "false, malicious, and defamatory."

Bajaj Finance, Bajaj Finserv shares gain amid housing unit IPO buzzThe buzz around the Bajaj Housing Finance IPO, which is set to make its stock market debut on September 16, has led traders on Dalal Street to snap up shares of other publicly traded Bajaj companies, hoping to capitalise on the momentum.

Western Carriers IPO opens for bidding: Should you subscribe or skip? Western Carriers (India) Limited has allocated 85,96,743 equity shares to 15 anchor investors, raising Rs 148 crore before its proposed IPO.
SpiceJet shares surge 9%: What's fuelling the rally and will it continue?SpiceJet share price: Despite regulatory challenges, the airline's shares have surged recently. Will the rally hold?

PN Gadgil Jewellers IPO allotment: Step-by-step guide to check statusPN Gadgil Jewellers IPO allotment: If you've applied for the IPO, you can check the allotment status online in a few simple steps through the websites of the BSE and Bigshare Services.

Bajaj Housing Finance IPO: Got allotment? Check expected listing gainsBrokerages tracking the IPO have already indicated that the IPO is set for a positive listing, with the grey market premium (GMP) indicating that investors will see their money double on listing day.
Adani Group shares drop after Hindenburg's fresh allegationsHindenburg Research claimed that Swiss authorities had frozen over $310 million across several Swiss bank accounts.
Sensex, Nifty pause rally near record highs; Bajaj twins gainThe S&P BSE Sensex fell 134.05 points to 82,828.66 at 10:28 am, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 44.30 points to 25,344.60.

Adani Group rejects Hindenburg claim of Swiss banks' $310 million funds freezeHindenburg cited a Swiss media outlet, Gotham City, which alleged that more than $310 million belonging to an alleged frontman for billionaire Gautam Adani is sequestered in six Swiss banks. The Adani Group "unequivocally" rejected the claim.

Amazon, Flipkart found violating Indian competition laws: ReportA probe by the Competition Commission of India (CCI) found that e-commerce giants Amazon and Flipkart engaged in anti-competitive practices by favouring select sellers on their platforms.

Understanding circle rates: A simple guide for homebuyers and sellersUnderstanding the concept of circle rates, and how they influence property valuations, has become critical for anyone navigating the real estate market.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Arvind Kejriwal to resign as Delhi Chief Minister: My fate in voters' handsArvind Kejriwal revealed that a member of the party would be named Chief Minister, with the decision to be made during a cabinet meeting set to take place in the coming two days.

Protesting doctors on Mamata Banerjee's tea offer: Only if justice is servedOn Saturday evening, despite the Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee's offer for tea, the protesting doctors vowed to continue their protests until their demand for justice in the rape and murder of the trainee doctor is fulfilled.

BJP drafted fantasy story, named it liquor scam: Manish SisodiaWhile addressing the AAP workers, senior party leader and MLA Manish Sisodia said that by granting bail to Arvind Kejriwal, the top court put a "full stop" on the "fantasy story" that was drafted by BJP in the name of a liquor policy scam.

Polaris Dawn astronauts return safely after historic five-day space missionThe crew, led by billionaire philanthropist Jared Isaacman, included mission pilot Scott "Kidd" Poteet and mission specialists Anna Menon and Sarah Gillis. (Photo: SpaceX)

Clothes fall, cameras roll: Intimacy coordinators make reel sex realistic, safeThe film industry is finding that it needs intimacy coordinators to shoot sex scenes as it requires stunt directors for action sequences. Intimacy coordinators tell us how they help make bedroom sequences as realistic as possible while taking care of the actors' safety and comfort. They also reveal the contents of their toolbox.

BJP mocks Arvind Kejriwal's resignation announcement, Congress calls it gimmickIn a video released by BJP Delhi on X, the party outlined the conditions under which Arvind Kejriwal was granted bail. The video emphasised that if one carefully considers the court's terms, there is little reason for celebration.

PM Modi's roadshow in Jamshedpur today cancelled due to rain: BJPPrime Minister Narendra Modi's roadshow in Jamshedpur was canceled due to heavy rain and bad weather. He virtually flagged off six Vande Bharat trains and distributed housing sanction letters under the PMAY-G scheme.

Deepika Padukone, Ranveer Singh leave hospital with newborn daughterDeepika Padukone has been discharged from the hospital after giving birth to a baby girl. On Sunday, September 15, Deepika and Ranveer Singh were seen leaving the hospital premises.

Post-Hasina Bangladesh gravitates towards Urdu and JinnahBangladesh, then East Pakistan, saw the Bangla language movement in 1952 against the imposition of Urdu by Pakistan. Five people who gave their lives are honoured as martyrs. But in post-Hasina Bangladesh, Mohammad Ali Jinnah's anniversary of death is being marked with Urdu poetry and songs.

Man dies after SUV rams his bike in Mumbai, accused driver on the runA man was killed while another injured after a speeding car hit a motorcycle in Mumbai's Dahisar. The incident occurred on September 13 around 4 pm, according to Dahisar Police.

PM virtually flags off 6 Vande Bharat trains for Jharkhand, Odisha, Bihar, UPPM Modi virtually flagged off six Vande Bharat trains for Jharkhand, Odisha, Bihar and UP at Ranchi, after his programme in Tatanagar was cancelled due to poor visibility and inclement weather.

Esha Deol opens up about period restrictions at homeEsha Deol recently spoke candidly about the limitations placed on women during menstruation in her household. She revealed that women are not permitted to visit temples while menstruating.

Mumbai-Doha IndiGo flight cancelled after 5-hour delay, passengers strandedAn IndiGo flight from Mumbai to Doha was cancelled after a five-hour delay, leaving passengers stranded at the airport. IndiGo has assured that affected passengers will be accommodated on subsequent flights and provided with necessary assistance.

'Cookie poll' predicts Trump leading against Kamala Harris in Pennsylvania A local bakery in the United States is conducting a unique 'cookie poll' to predict the outcome of the upcoming presidential election. The poll involves selling cookies decorated with the names of Kamala Harris and Donald Trump, with sales being tallied as votes.
Deepika Padukone changes Instagram bio after welcoming baby girlDeepika Padukone updated her Instagram bio after childbirth. She shared a cute update about her baby girl.

Influencer reunites ailing grandmother with childhood friends after 50 yearsAn Instagram influencer brought his grandmother to tears by reuniting her with childhood friends she hadn't seen in over 50 years.
Question Time: Weekly News QuizThink you read the headlines this week? Let's test that!

Prashant Kishor vows to end Bihar liquor ban within an hour if electedAhead of the launch of his political party, Jan Suraaj, Prashant Kishor pledged to scrap the ban on liquor in Bihar, saying that it led to illegal home deliveries of alcohol and deprived the state of Rs 20,000 crore in excise revenue.

Is it okay to get married right after ending a long-term relationship?Getting over a breakup is never easy, and diving into a new relationship too quickly can be even riskier. However, much depends on how well a person has processed and healed from the past.

Watch: Man tries to approach Siddaramaiah at Bengaluru event, breaches securitySecurity personnel, exhibiting swift reflexes, intervened just inches from the Chief Minister, bringing the situation under control before it escalated.
Israel military says missile fired from Yemen, sirens sounded across citiesThe military said that the missile landed in an unpopulated area in Central Israel and no one was injured after it hit.

67% of engineers fear job losses due to AI, 87% working to upskillOver 67% of engineers feel their jobs are at risk due to AI automation and technology usage, with 87% planning to upskill in areas like AI and machine learning to stay competitive.

Finally, a Mamata masterstroke. But why did it take a month?After 34 days of misreading the agitation and showing her arrogance, Mamata Banerjee reached out to the protesting doctors, not as the West Bengal Chief Minister but as their "didi". But why did the "manush" masterstroke come so late, and how has Mamata won this round?

Saira Banu talks about Padosan re-releasing in theatresVeteran actor Saira Banu spoke about the re-release of Padosan. She urged the new generation to experience the film's charm.

sports.headline: Sancho just needs some love: Chelsea boss Maresca after winger's big debutJadon Sancho impressed on his Chelsea debut, assisting the winning goal against Bournemouth. Boss Enzo Maresca praised the winger's performance, predicting more brilliance ahead as Sancho settles into his new role following his loan from Manchester United.

Shubman Gill set to be rested for T20I series vs BangladeshIndia vice-captain Shubman Gill is likely to be rested for the upcoming three-match T20I series against Bangladesh starting October 7, following BCCI's workload management policy. Several other key players will also be rested to prepare for the three-Test series against New Zealand scheduled for later in October.

Watch: Yash Dubey's unfortunate dismissal at non-striker's end in Duleep TrophyYash Dubey got involved in an unfortunate run out on Day 4 of the second round in the Duleep Trophy against India A in Anantpur.

Mohammed Shami backs India to complete hat-trick in AustraliaIndia tour of Australia: Pacer Mohammad Shami believes India have a good chance of winning the Test series for the third successive time against Australia Down Under this winter.

Emery admits selection headache after Aston Villa's 3-2 win over EvertonAston Villa manager Unai Emery admits facing a challenge in managing his striking options after a thrilling 3-2 comeback win against Everton. Jhon Duran and Ollie Watkins both impressed, creating a selection headache for the manager.

People advised me to commit suicide: Navdeep Singh recalls harrowing pastIndia's Navdeep Singh recently recalled how he used society's harsh words as motivation to face the hardships of life. Navdeep revealed how people advised him to commit suicide.

R Ashwin reveals his retirement plans ahead of Bangladesh TestsIndia vs Bangladesh: Ace Indian spinner Ravichandran Ashwin has spoken about his future in international cricket, stating that his retirement will come when he no longer feels the drive to improve his game.

Aakash Chopra recalls how MS Dhoni's audacious shot left him stunned in 2004Former India cricketer Aakash Chopra recently recalled how MS Dhoni left him stunned with his batting during an India A tour in 2004.

Ashwin always has a plan: Khawaja lauds Indian spinner ahead of Test seriesAustralia opener Usman Khawaja praised Indian spinner Ravichandran Ashwin for his strategic approach and cricketing brain. As the BGT series approaches, Ashwin's impressive record against Australia makes him a key player to watch.

Pakistan board removes daily allowance of women cricketers in national campsThe Pakistan Cricket Board has decided to stop daily allowances for women players in national camps, citing provision of accommodation and meals. The move has sparked disappointment amongst players, especially as male counterparts receive allowances.

Younis Khan advises Babar Azam to learn 'major lesson' from Virat KohliFormer Pakistan cricketer Younis Khan wants Babar Azam to learn from Virat Kohli and focus on team's performance instead of retaining his captaincy.

Messi marks injury return with two goals in Miami's 3-1 win vs UnionLionel Messi made a significant return from injury, scoring two goals and delivering an assist in Inter Miami's 3-1 victory over the Philadelphia Union on Saturday night.

Chelsea beat Bournemouth, set record for most yellow cards in Premier League Chelsea's substitute Christopher Nkunku scored the decisive goal in the 86th minute, sealing a 1-0 victory over Bournemouth in a match that saw a record 14 yellow cards. Despite Bournemouth's pressure and missed opportunities, Chelsea managed to come out on top.

Cautious Mohammed Shami not looking to rush himself back into actionStar India fast bowler has revealed that he isn't looking to rush himself back into action ahead of the packed Test season. Shami has been sidelined since the ODI World Cup 2023 due to an ankle injury.

Neeraj Chopra's solid 2024 despite injury: Olympic silver and three 89+ throwsNeeraj Chopra's 2024 was one that was marred by injury, but the Indian star still went on to produce an Olympic silver and 3 89-plus throws. Neeraj's season came to an end with his second-place finish at the Diamond League final in Brussels on Saturday, September 14.

Neeraj Chopra finishes 2nd in Diamond League Final behind Anderson PetersIndia's Neeraj Chopra finished second in the Diamond League Final 2024, behind Grenada's Anderson Peters. Neeraj's 87.86m throw came just 0.01m short of Peters' best attempt in Brussels.

Travis Head reveals India not his favourite opponent: 'They are difficult'Australia batter Travis Head has said that India is not his favourite opponent to play against. Head did well against Rohit Sharma's team in the 2023 season, hitting 2 centuries in the WTC and World Cup Final.

ISL: Hometown hero Vinith Venkatesh nets winner as Bengaluru FC beat East BengalHometown boy Vinith Venkatesh was the star of the show as Bengaluru FC started their ISL 2024-25 campaign with a 1-0 win over East Bengal on Saturday, September 14.

BAN govt rewards cricket team with BDT 3.2 crore for series win vs PakistanBangladesh government announced a mega-cash reward for their men's cricket team on Saturday, September 14. The government handed the side Rs 3.20 crore Bangladesh Taka to the national team for their historic Test series win against Pakistan.

Diamond League Final Highlights: Neeraj finishes 2nd, misses Diamond Trophy by 0.01 mNeeraj Chopra Highlights at Diamond League final: India's Neeraj Chopra finished second in the Diamond League Final on Saturday, September 14, behind Paris Olympics bronze medallist Anderson Peters in the men's javelin competition. Competing at the King Baudouin Stadium in Brussels, Neeraj's best attempt was 87.86 meters, just one centimetre behind Peters. Peters won the prestigious Diamond Trophy, announcing his return to form in the 2024 season.

Premier League: Liverpool lose to Forest at Anfield for first time in 55 yearsLiverpool fell to a 0-1 loss against Nottingham Forest at the Anfield on Saturday, September 14. This was the first time in 55 years that the hosts lost a game to Forest at home.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.

WC influential ten: Writers community honors digital social change makersWriters Community Freelancers Releases 'WC Influential Ten' List Recognizing Social Impact through Virtual Space and Social Media
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
